org.colomoto.mddlib

Interface MDDManager

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    MDDStore
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    MDDManagerProxy, MDDStoreImpl

    public interface MDDManager
    A MDD manager is responsible for the creation, storage, retrieval, combination and cleanup of a collection of multi-valued decision diagrams (MDDs).


    The manager has:

    • a set of leaves, defined from start and that can not be changed,
    • a list of variables. New ones can be added afterwards, and the names can be changed but changing max values resets the manager

    A number of leaves are defined when creating the manager. They are numbered [0...nbleaves[. Negative leaves or holes in the values are not allowed, but you are free to map indices to the values of your choice (including inside custom operators).
    The same leaf can thus refer to different values, depending on the context.

    Nodes can be created using the get_bnode and get_mnode methods (for Boolean and multi-valued nodes respectively), which create them if needed and return the bloc ID.

    Nodes can also be created by combining existing nodes, using the merge method. This method uses MDDOperations to decide how to do the merging. MDDOperation for the common operations are provided (see MDDOperation.ACTION_*), but it was designed to help creating custom ones. A group-merging method allows to efficiently merge many nodes using the same operation.

    Nodes also have reference counter, which allows to reuse the space when nodes are no longer used. For this, call the free method with a node ID when you stop using it. Make sure to forget the ID as any further use would result in unexpected results.

    Author:
    Aurelien Naldi

    • Method Detail

      • getManager

        MDDManager getManager(List<?> order)
        Get a new manager for this MDD Store, using a custom variable order. The new manager will use the same MDDStore as backend: it is just a different view of the same MDD dataset.
        Parameters:
        order - requested variable order.
        Returns:
        a new manager (this if the order is the same)

      • getNodeVariable

        MDDVariable getNodeVariable(int n)
        Get the variable associated to a given node.
        Parameters:
        n - the node ID
        Returns:
        the variable of null if the node is a leaf.

      • getVariableForKey

        MDDVariable getVariableForKey(Object key)
        Get the MDDVariable associated to a given key.
        Parameters:
        key -
        Returns:
        the associated MDDVariable

      • getVariableIndex

        int getVariableIndex(MDDVariable var)
        Get the position of a given variable in this manager's list of variables.
        Parameters:
        var -
        Returns:
        the position in getAllVariables().

      • getAllVariables

        MDDVariable[] getAllVariables()
        Get all MDDVariables in this manager.
        Returns:
        the ordered list of available MDDVariables.

      • free

        void free(int pos)
        Free a node. If it is not used at all anymore, it will be removed from the data structure.

        This should be used for each node id that was obtained through one of the get_?node() method, or for the one explicitly marked as used.

        Note that the space will be made available for new nodes, but it will NOT be returned to the garbage collector.

        Parameters:
        pos -
        See Also:
        use(int), get_bnode(int, int, int), get_mnode(int, int[])

      • use

        int use(int node)
        Mark a node as used. This is done automatically when creating or reusing a node. In most cases, manually calling this should not be necessary. If you do call it, remember to call free(int) when you release it.
        Parameters:
        node -
        Returns:
        the ID of the node (yes, the same as the parameter, just as convenience)

      • isleaf

        boolean isleaf(int node)
        Parameters:
        node - the ID of the tested node.
        Returns:
        true if id denotes a leaf in this manager

      • getChild

        int getChild(int node,
           int value)
        Get a specific child for a node. Note: the child is not counted as used, do not free it (or call manager.use() before)
        Parameters:
        node - id of a node
        value - assignment value
        Returns:
        the id of the child node reached when assigning this value to the variable of the provided node.

      • getChildren

        int[] getChildren(int node)
        Get all the children of a given node. Node: this will create a new array to hold the children. Children are not counted as used, do not free them (or call manager.use() before)
        Parameters:
        node -
        Returns:
        an array holding all the children, or null if it is a leaf.

      • not

        int not(int node)
        Logical not, performed by flipping leaves 0 and 1.
        Parameters:
        node -
        Returns:
        the ID of the flipped MDD root

      • getRelation

        NodeRelation getRelation(int first,
                       int other)
        Determine the relation between two nodes. Mainly used by operators to select the appropriate code path.
        Parameters:
        first -
        other -
        Returns:
        an NodeRelation value denoting which node is a leaf or has the highest ranked variable

      • getNodeCount

        int getNodeCount()
        Returns:
        the number of non-leaf nodes stored in the manager.

      • getSign

        int getSign(int node,
          MDDVariable pivot)
        Infer the effect of a variable in a given MDD.
        Parameters:
        node - the MDD
        pivot - the variable of interest
        Returns:
        0 for no effect, 1 for positive effect, -1 for negative effect or 2 for dual effect

      • reach

        byte reach(int node,
         byte[] values)
        Find the leaf reached for a given variable assignment
        Parameters:
        node -
        values -
        Returns:
        the leaf reached for this assignment

      • collectDecisionVariables

        boolean[] collectDecisionVariables(int node)
        Collect variables on which a MDD depends.
        Parameters:
        node -
        Returns:
        a boolean array indicating for each variable if it affects the given MDD.
